thread.title: Chelsea make Arsenal's Alexis Sanchez their top target? Transfer news and gossip from Wednesday's papers
thread.title_full: Chelsea make Arsenal's Alexis Sanchez their top target? Transfer news and gossip from Wednesday's papers

author: Football Spy
title: Chelsea make Arsenal's Alexis Sanchez their top target? Transfer news and gossip from Wednesday's papers
text:
Sport Chelsea make Arsenal's Alexis Sanchez their top target? Transfer news and gossip from Wednesday's papers PLUS: Manchester United reportedly want to sign Eric Dier AND Barcelona are favourites to sign PSG's Marco Verratti Share Chelsea are eyeing Arsenal's Alexis Sanchez (Photo: Shaun Botterill)     
Chelsea have made Alexis Sanchez their No 1 summer transfer target, according to reports. 
The Guardian say Antonio Conte has made it clear to Chelsea's recruitment team that he wants to sign Sanchez as well as a left-sided defender in the summer. 
It is claimed Sanchez, who has 15 months to run on his current £130,000-a-week contract at the Emirates, is demanding £250,000-a-week at Arsenal or whichever club he next signs for. 
The Daily Mail say Arsenal are unwilling to let Sanchez join a domestic rival, leaving PSG, Juventus and Inter Milan as potential destinations for the Chilean. 
Neither Real Madrid or Barcelona are interested in signing the 28-year-old. Top stories from Wednesday's Mirror 
TRANSFERS 
Arsenal will demand at least £50million for Alexis Sanchez if the forward refuses to sign a new deal. The Gunners will stick to their guns over their valuation, even though the 28-year-old will have just a year left on his contract come the summer. Arsenal will reportedly demand £50million for the Chilean (Photo: Stuart MacFarlane) 
Erik Lamela and Moussa Sissoko — the two most expensive signings in Tottenham’s history — have both been targeted for summer moves to Italy. Inter Milan think they can land attacking midfielder Lamela, signed in a £30m deal four years ago, for around £10million. Juventus and rivals AC Milan are understood to be interested in midfielder Sissoko, who has been a massive disappointment in his debut season since his £30m move from relegated Newcastle. 
Middlesbrough defender Ben Gibson will cost the Premier League big guns £25million in the summer. The 24-year-old, called into the most recent England squad as an injury replacement, is his relegation-threatened club's prize asset and will be sold at a premium if they do drop out of the top flight. Manchester City and Liverpool are leading the chase to sign him. 
Chelsea star Eden Hazard WILL move to Real Madrid this summer if he wants to go, according to a former president of the Spanish giants. Eden Hazard is being linked with a move to Real Madrid (Photo: PA) 
The president of Houston Dynamo has warned Manchester United and England captain Wayne Rooney not to expect to be making easy money if he moves to MLS. 
OTHER NEWS 
EXCLUSIVE - West Ham are poised to move for Rafa Benitez if Slaven Bilic is unable to halt the club’s slide. The Londoners have lost their last three Premier League games and are without a win in five matches. Manager Bilic’s position will be assessed at the end of the season as part of the Hammers annual review. Former Liverpool and Chelsea boss Benitez is on course for promotion from the Championship at the first time of asking with Newcastle, but his future at St James' Park remains uncertain following his clear frustration over their lack of January signings. Rafa the Hammer? (Photo: Newcastle Chronicle) 
EXCLUSIVE - Harry Kane is set to hand Tottenham a massive boost by returning early from his latest ankle injury. The England striker has a chance of playing a part in the home game against Bournemouth on April 15 — which comes a week before an FA Cup semi-final with Chelsea. Spurs are understood not to be ruling anything out in relation to his return. 
EXCLUSIVE - Former Newcastle No2 Terry McDermott tells in his new book how manager Kevin Keegan was duped into selling James Milner to Aston Villa by the club's top brass in the belief they were buying Bastian Schweinsteiger — only to discover they had offered Bayern Munich just €5million, a sum that literally made the Germans laugh. Transfer news from other newspapers and websites 
Manchester United are targeting a summer swoop for Spurs versatility man Eric Dier, who is valued at £40million (Sun) Jose Mourinho is reportedly keen to sign Spurs and England man Eric Dier (Photo: Michael Regan - The FA) 
Chelsea are set to offer Eden Hazard a £300,000-a-week contract to stave off interest from Real Madrid (Sun) 
Barcelona are in pole position to land Marco Verratti from PSG - leaving Chelsea disappointed (Goal) 
Tiemoue Bakayoko is keen on a move to Manchester United but only if he the club make it into next season's Champions League (Manchester Evening News) Like us on Facebook
